node.title: Man who kidnapped toddler in 'horrendously misplaced' adoption plot released after time served
node.alt: Two shots of man from CCTV without the baby entering the home.
node.description: Olando Aleki, 31, is sentenced to three years in jail after pleadingÂ guilty to child stealing and entering a dwelling with intent. He is being released from jail after time served, and could now face deportation.
node.content:
["A man who told people he was \"adopting\" a child days before kidnapping a toddler with whom he had formed an \"obsession\" will be released after serving less than a year in jail.", "In the District Court in Brisbane on Thursday, Olando Aleki, 31, pleaded guilty to one count each of child stealing and entering a dwelling with intent.", "Last February, Aleki disguised himself in a surgical mask and wore leather gloves to break into a Darra home in Brisbane's south-west, where he snatched the 20-month-old from his cot in the early hours of the morning.", "A CCTV camera captured Aleki taking the child from the house, sparking an Amber alert with police quickly becoming concerned the boy was at significant risk.", "Several hours later, Aleki was tracked to his Salisbury home and the boy was discovered \"distressed and overheated\".", "The court heard he had known the child's mother and despite spending \"limited time\" with the boy between late 2020\u00a0and early 2021, he became obsessed with the idea of becoming his parent.", "In the days leading up to the abduction, he had told family members he would be \"adopting a child\" and started buying children's items in preparation, the court heard.", "", "
The toddler with his grandfather.(ABC News: Sally Eeles)
", "His lawyer Ed Whitton told the court it was a \"very unusual matter\", but his client had no \"nefarious\" motives and had not harmed the boy.", "\"There is no question it is objectively very serious,\" he said.", "Mr Whitton said his client had a \"horrendously misplaced and misguided instinct\" to take the boy and raise him himself.", "\"[Aleki] perceived rightly or wrongly that he could provide that care, care that he hadn't received himself as a child,\" he said.", "The court heard Aleki suffered an adjustment disorder and was subject to \"repeated attachment disruption\" during his childhood, but had no psychiatric conditions that would deprive him of the capacity to understand his actions.", "
'I can no longer trust anybody'
", "A victim impact statement from the boy's grandmother \u2014 who is his primary carer \u2014 was read to the court.\u00a0", "She said the night he was taken she was \"terrified\".", "\"I felt sick and in disbelief,\" she said.", "She said the boy now has separation anxiety and she had become \"overprotective\" and constantly \"on edge\", even after moving house.", "\"I don't feel comfortable leaving [him] with anyone \u2014 I can no longer trust anybody. I just can't get past the worry.\"", "", "
Police forensic officers at the toddler's home shortly after he was taken.(ABC News: Sally Eeles)
", "Judge Orazio Rinaudo told the court Aleki's offending \"defies belief\" and acknowledged the \"traumatising effect\" it had on the boy and his family.", "\"You formed the intention to take the child for some misguided reason,\" he said.", "\"It's no doubt that the horror, the panic that was described \u2026 would have gripped his family.\"", "
'It's upsetting'
", "Judge Rinaudo sentenced Aleki to three years in jail, suspended after 312 days, which he has already served.", "Aleki was also given a three-year parole order and warned that due to his New Zealand citizenship he will likely face deportation following his release.", "Outside court, the boy's grandfather was in tears and said he had been \"expecting a bit more\" from the judicial process.", "\"To know that someone can break into someone's house, steal a child, and then just get given keys to walk out of prison just 312 days later, that's what hurts the most,\" he said.", "\"The feeling of knowing he's in the community and you can run into him at any time is scary \u2013 it's upsetting.\""]
